entry.et: Middle English, from Old English andlang, from and- against + lang long ante-

def.dt: :in a line matching the length or direction of walking along the road
:at a point or points on a house along the river
:in the course of made stops along the way
:in accordance with :in a new agreement along the lines of the first
:forward on move along
:from one to another word was passed along
:in company :as a companion brought his wife along often used with with walked to school along with her friends
:in association used with with work along with colleagues
:sometime within a specified or implied extent of time usually used with about along about July 17
:at or to an advanced point plans are far along
:in addition :also usually used with with a bill came along with the package
:at hand :as a necessary or useful item brought an extra one along had his gun along
:on hand :there tell him I'll be along to see him

entry.et: Middle English ilong on, from Old English gelang on, from ge-, associative prefix + lang co-

def.dt: :because of
:all the time knew the truth all along
:to accompany someone who leads the way asked me to come along on the trip
:to make progress work is coming along well
:to make an appearance won't just marry the first man that comes along
:a small portable winch usually consisting of a cable attached to a hand-operated ratchet
:to proceed toward a destination :progress
:to approach an advanced stage
:to approach old age
:to meet one's needs :manage we got along on a minimum of clothing
:to be or remain on congenial terms
:to move along :proceed
:to go or travel as a companion
:to act in cooperation or express agreement go along with the crowd
:to go away :be on one's way :depart
:songfest
:a song appropriate for a sing-along
